channel.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Wind chills of 40Ëš-below expected
item.description: An Arctic surge will bring bitter cold air to the Northeast this weekend, with record low temperatures expected.

item.title: Cop's disbelief: 'They're shooting at me'
item.description: Sgt. Capps got on his police radio: suspects are arming themselves and putting on vests. Then the back window of the SUV exploded.

item.title: Dem debate: Were they truthful?
item.description: The Democratic candidates for president gathered in Milwaukee on Thursday for their sixth debate, and CNN's Reality Check team spent the night putting their statements and assertions to the test.

item.title: No suspect believed to be at large, police in Arizona say
Your body when you fall in love
item.description: Butterflies in your stomach, a racing heartbeatâ€”you probably remember those symptoms well from your first middle school crush. As an adult, they're actually your body's subtle clues that you're falling in love (or lust, at least). At the start of a relationship, a series of truly fascinating chemical reactions occur throughout your nervous system and hormones. From the first time you meet to climbing under the sheets, here's what's happening to your body as you fall in love.

item.title: Man with machete hurts 4 in Ohio
item.description: A man wielding a machete stormed a restaurant in Columbus, Ohio, and attacked multiple people before he was killed by police, authorities said on Thursday.

item.title: New Kanye-Taylor Swift feud?
item.description: It's the Kanye West and Taylor Swift drama -- the sequel.

item.title: Autopsy: Cops shot man 20 times
item.description: Mario Woods, who was shot dead by San Francisco police, had more than 20 gunshot wounds, according to an autopsy report.

item.title: Sanders throws shade in debate
item.description: President Barack Obama was the star of Thursday night's debate between Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders.

item.title: How photobomb created a star
item.description: It's a classic case of being in the right place at the right time. A young street seller oblivious to the scene ahead, her wares perched atop her head, photobombed a shoot and in that split second her life changed forever.

item.title: Astronaut: Earth looks 'kind of sick'
item.description: In one of his final interviews from the International Space Station, astronaut Scott Kelly said that the Earth's atmosphere "looks very, very fragile" and "like something that we need to take care of."

item.title: NYPD officer guilty of manslaughter
item.description: Officer Peter Liang, who shot and killed an unarmed man in a New York housing project stairwell in 2014, was found guilty of manslaughter and official misconduct Thursday.

item.title: Charge in Harrison Ford's leg injury
item.description: The production company behind "Star Wars Episode VII: The Force Awakens" is being prosecuted by British workplace safety authorities over a 2014 accident that left star Harrison Ford with a broken leg.

item.title: Cool things to see under London
item.description: Subterranean London is a world of mausoleums, secret bunkers, lost rivers and twisting tunnels. Here are four of the best things to see below the surface

item.title: The week in 33 photos
item.description: Take a look at 33 photos of the week from February 5 through February 11.

item.title: Kids try to 'breathe less' after leak
Cruz pulls ad with porn actress
item.description: Ted Cruz's campaign pulled a recent ad attacking Marco Rubio after it was revealed that one of its featured actors had performed in erotic films.

item.title: Brockovich: Assault to community
item.description: Environmental activist Erin Brockovich says that the Porter Ranch, California, gas leak has released 187 million pounds of methane gas into the atmosphere.

item.title: Dad: They took our kids' home
item.description: Routine is crucial to the Donah family; Chase, 7, has autism, and needs it to function well. But their routine changed drastically when they woke up one morning and smelled gas.

item.title: 10 romantic destinations you should know about
item.description: Paris is romantic.

item.title: The strange world of 'love motels'
Columbine killer's mom speaks
item.description: Her son and his friend killed 13 people at Columbine High School almost 17 years ago. Sue Klebold has lived with guilt since -- guilt for what her son did and how she, a loving mother, raised a boy who became a mass murderer.

item.title: The paradise island shaped like a heart
item.description: Lingerie fittings in China. Karma Sutra sculptures in India. These wildly romantic journeys beat a candle-lit dinner

item.title: RIP little comet lander: Scientists give up on Philae
item.description: Philae made history when it became the first man-made object to land on a comet in 2014. But after multiple attempts to reestablish contact, scientists say the probe "faces eternal hibernation."

item.title: Did X-ray miss laptop bomb?
item.description: The explosive device built into a laptop computer that detonated last week on a Somali passenger jet was "sophisticated" and got past X-ray machines at the Mogadishu airport, a source close to the investigation told CNN, raising concerns about security measures at airports across Africa and internationally.
